channel.title: Ep3 Source engine features...
channel.description:
The Ep1 Source engine added HDR and better facial animation, the Ep2 version added dynamic lighting and the ability to render big open spaces.
So what technical improvements/features do you think the Ep3 Source engine will have? What would you want it to have?
Personally, even though I'm not a graphics whore I do think (and hope) that there will be some graphical improvements. It would also be nice to have a 64bit version of STEAM and the new Ep3 Source games that doesn't suck (64bit HL2 anyone?).
Also, better AI and NPC interactions.

item.title: Ep3 Source engine features...

item.description:
Unreal Engine 4 looks fantastic … Source Engine is better.
O_O
Come on Valve, show us some new technology already “_”

item.title: Ep3 Source engine features...
item.dc:creator: Speed
item.description:
Alright before you say that Story is more important then graphics,and I realize this, but I agree with you. Look at Left 4 Dead 2, and look at its outro for the Dead Center campaign, the racecar recieves a little damage from crashing through the doors if you look closely (I know you dont directly control the car but still.) I like the story of games, and I rarely nitpick on graphics (and never when its designed to be simple, like LoZ Windwaker, or minecraft), But look at this stuff, if they can render a giant robot rebuilding itself (Portal 2) and a Bridge that was pretty much the whole level you just went across exploding (Left 4 dead 2, skip three minutes in)

Then i’m pretty sure they can add a few bumps to a car after crashing it if they can do this.

Long post (Compared to how much i normally type), but I kinda realize some of the flaws with this after talking to a friend on steam.

Read full topic

item.title: Ep3 Source engine features...
item.dc:creator: Speed
item.description:
Kairouseki:

Because of all the cars in the HL series that would benefit from it right?

Im not saying do it all like the video, I just find it extremely unrealistic when you have say the Jalopy, which is pretty much just a regular sports car with a little rust, and your able to drive it off a cliff, and there is absolutely, NO, damage.
Its always something that bothered me, because im kind of a reckless driver in videogames, so for me, it stuck out alot.

Read full topic

item.title: Ep3 Source engine features...
item.dc:creator: Speed
item.description:
The only thing I wanna see is improved vehicle crashing.

Instead of driving a 100mph right into a wall, with absolutely no damage to the car, and only about 20-10 hp taken off Gordon.

Even if it only has minor dents and bumps, I wanna see damage, instead of god cars.

Read full topic

That video only shows particle physics, it has nothing to do with actual fluid dynamics, which are very expensive to calculate.

item.title: Ep3 Source engine features...
item.dc:creator: amazingcomedy
item.description:
beeseik:

lolling at people who want dynamic water. That shit is way too expensive to run. Blender can do it really well but I think it has to bake for a shitlong time.

Not really. This video is a good example of dynamic water in the Source engine. It’s not the fanciest looking thing, but it’s a start.
